review: I feel like giving this bar a 1 is being kind. My friends were in town for a girls weekend and were looking for a place to grab a nightcap after dinner. We thought there was no way Fridays could mess up a chocolate martini, because several bars on Fourth Street didn't have it on their menu. The waiting area was full of people, one pitiful disorganized hostess wouldn't seat us at an outside bar table, since it 'was first come, first served', but told us we couldn't have it because she needed to 'go thru the list of waiting people first' (funny-ad everyone waiting had kids, and clearly couldn't sit out there.) and there were tables for the waiting customers too. Everyone waiting, including the hostess appeared to have felt defeated in life, and really okay with waiting an indefinite amount of time. We walked out-I said later this particular Fridays needs to have their 'Forth Street rights taken away.' Step it up, Fridays-get your act together in Louisville.

I'm sure this is going to sound bizarre but I've never eaten at a TGI Fridays before.  Now that I work at Fourth Street Live, I've visited this place a couple times.  I like it a lot.  The manager is such a nice guy, very attentive and always smiling.  That was the first thing I noticed.  The food is good, it's your typical chain restaurant fare, which is fine because it's worth the price you are paying, which isn't expensive.  If you want to really enjoy your time here, sit outside.  It's fun to people watch.  Enjoy.

After 10pm, one of their happy hour times, they have some great deals. Like $4 margaritas, a dollar off drinks and food, and $5 appetizers. Following a late rehearsal at the Cathedral of the Assumption, a few fellow choir members and I stopped in for a drink and some much needed food (ok....the drink was much needed too). Appetizers come in a decent size. We each got one and all shared and there was PLENTY of food. The margarita I got was perhaps more than I needed...and that is a personal thing, not a "how they made it" thing. I don't plan to be here often because I tend to avoid 4th Street Live, but it's better than the Hard Rock.

Unfortunately this place is the worst Fridays I have ever eaten at.  You can tell the management does not train their staff well and they survive on having a great location at 4th street live.  I have been there twice and never again.  Both times the Jack Daniels burger was slapped together without the lettuce and tomato, the meat was dry and disgusting, and very little jack daniels sauce and the bun was dry and not toasted.  I can make better burgers at home. The hosts and hostesses are always screwing around up front, laughing and giggling and generally unprofessional.  I will never go back.

Stoped here for dinner & a drink before a fun party night. Yet after a horrible Howl at the Moon I went back to Fridays. Not only are the friendly but they remembered my bf & I. We ended up spending awhile at Fridays, had a few drinks ordered more food & called it a night. I have to say after 2 nights on 4th street Fridays was the highlight, great for Fridays but sad for 4th street. Highly recc Fridays!!!!

Generally not a fan of Fridays. This one offered no surprises.  Came for happy hour and ordered spinach with chips, hot pretzels and drinks.  It was ok. Service was a little slow, but we did eventually get food.  Restaurant business is hard, I realize they are just doing their job, but not a place I would make  efforts, however large or small, to return.

I have eaten at this location a few times, mostly before events at nearby venues. After last night, I would dare not try to eat there again. With this location being on 4th Street Live, a major downtown entertainment district and within walking distance of the Yum! Center, you would think they would have their game going when someone like Justin Timberlake comes to town. Eight of us made reservations at 6:00.  The concert was at 8:00.  We sat down, ordered drinks, apps and entrees. And by the time 7:20 rolled around, we still did not have our appetizers. We saw people who came in after us eat dinners, get desserts and our waiter was nowhere to be found. We asked for a manager, but he would not come out.  The waiter said, "I know you all have places to be, but we can't guarantee your appetizers will be out before 8:00."   I demanded the manager to come out, but the waiter said, "He is on the line." I demanded again and he came out. We told him to cancel our order and we would eat somewhere else and maybe that will speed up service.  He comped our drinks, but it wasn't enough because of the hassle we went through to get to the venue on time, without dinner.  An hour and a half fully wasted, with reservations. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I haven't been to a TGI Fridays in years, but since it was the only place open that night after the snow storm, we decided to try it out.  We sat at the bar and I ordered some blackberry long island type drink that was okay. My guy went with a beer and we ordered a meal to share and a side salad.  We got the wedge salad, which was pretty standard and good. It's one of my favorites, so I will often order it over others.  The steak dinner was oddly plated with different things including a bowl of cherry tomatoes. Although it didn't look appealing, it was just ok. Not expensive and not fantastic either.  Overall just okay for dinner and probably wouldn't return to a TGI Fridays unless I was going for drinks only.

Completely unprepared for any rush! Half hour to order, most of our group left after there order had been in for an hour. We stayed and got our food just before it hit 2 hours since sitting down, which was 30 minutes after our reservation. The food was food and so we ate it, not a glowing endorsement.

I don't go to TGI Fridays as much as I used to since the only location is now at 4th St Live.  I've always liked Fridays so I usually eat here when I do go to 4th St.  Went for a concert so we had dinner at Fridays before the show.  I have to say my experience here was very nice with some of that being due to the company.  We ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken and Shrimp Platter and decided to share it since it is a large entrée.  This was the first time I tried this and it was really good; also ordered a side of sweet potato fries.  I got a blackberry Long Island Tea which was very good.  Our server was very friendly and service was good.  I wish there was another location except 4th St. so I could make it here more often.
Went for lunch with friends.   Took forever to get food and order was wrong.  Left without eating never go back.

Other than meeting here w/a large group for a birthday, this is really my first time eating here at this location. Our server was nice, but forgetful and absent.  Our food arrived in a mediocre portion & barely warm, as if it sat the entire time that we were looking at our watches, wondering when it would arrive. I talked my boyfriend into Friday's since he wanted to go to another restaurant on 4th St., as I always had a great experience when it was in the east end.  He won't let me live this down & we will never go back.

The food and drinks at TGI Fridays are pretty much what you'd expect from a chain restaurant of this type. The food is mostly of the frozen/heated/deep fried variety and the drinks seem to be made with overly sweet bottled mixes. However, I can say that I've attended several group happy hours at Fridays and they've all been fine. The service is always good and the food/drinks are really cheap. If you're looking for a place quickly, or you have a large group, Fridays can usually accommodate you.

TGI Friday's is a pretty accurate embodiment of mediocrity. It's what you'd typically expect from these types of chain restaurants. Despite the fact that I'm not overly excited about Friday's, I actually dine here quite often because my coworker's love it. I would probably never chose to come here if it wasn't for that fact. I've tried many things from the lunch menu. I usually get some sort of combination of sandwich or soup and the wedge salad. Nothing I've had has been horrible. The food is decent enough. The service is friendly enough and quick enough. The prices are reasonable enough. Friday's is fine for an occasional lunch, but it's nothing to get excited about. There are far more better options around town. As an aside, I do have one complaint. As mentioned before, I like to get the wedge salad, however, the wedge salad is not included in part of their lunch combo. The lunch combo includes a house or caesar salad (rant: the wedge and house salads are the same price on their regular menu, so I'm not sure why the wedge isn't part of the combo??). Anyway, despite the fact that it's not included on the lunch combo, I always ask if I can substitute the wedge salad. I've had three different responses to my request. 1. The most common: They upcharge for the wedge salad. 2. I was told that it's not possible to substitute the wedge salad, and that I must order it separately if that's what I want. 3. They substituted the wedge salad without any upcharge. Three totally different actions - totally inconsistent! I could just be bitter that it's no longer included on the lunch menu, but there you have my wedge salad rant.

Beer was cold..... Like ice cold and froze..... Steaks were pretty damn good.... Not sure what the Mac n cheese was??? It wasn't all that..... But the wait time sucked..... And we waited for the waitress to run my card for about 20 minutes....

Food is pretty good but the service is usually TERRIBLE. I've had maybe one good server in the 6-8 times I've been there over the past year.  It's a shame really because my friends and I do like the food and it's close for lunch. Is there ever a manager on duty?  Never seen one but maybe that would help to get your order taken...or refills...or your table cleared...etc.

Good food!! Had the wedge salad and sampled all my friends' food too and everything was spot on. BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY, we were in a rush and the waitress brought out our food in under 10 min. And she was super nice. Loved her!
I decided to get ribs here a few days ago. they where disgusting. Nothing will make me want to come back here again. the service was great.

Let me start by saying that this is hands down the worst establishment I've ever been to. I was really, really hungry so I decided to try this place. The hostess was just taking her time seating us and when we asked for a booth, she told us that the 8 empty booths were closed but could sit in the bar area. We managed to find a booth luckily. The waiter came by, didn't bother to introduce himself or say hi, and just stood there. We guessed maybe we should just order? Okay then. The food came and it was disappointing just by the look of it. Also its kind of hard to eat without SILVERWARE. We asked a passing waitress for a set. And she said 'okay' and went off to where I can now assume to not get our silverware. One person in our party waited over ten minutes before getting up and finding a set. Other employees actually watched us trying to find silverware and didn't even offer to help. The same waitress came by five minutes later to give silverware to ANOTHER table and didn't even bother with us. Most of the order was wrong. The bread on the French dip was burnt, the salad orders were wrong and drenched with vinaigrette. We couldn't even send it back because the waiter never checked on us. The manager had to comp our whole meal after asking us what we wanted her to do about it. Whatever. This place has nothing redeeming about it. Don't go.

I ate here for lunch on a Friday with my coworker. We ordered the potsticker appetizer (free with email sign up) which was quite good. I had the $7.99 lunch combo with chicken fingers, fries and French onion soup. Everything was very good; both the chicken and soup were piping hot. I had to be careful with the cheese in the soup because it is so thick it is easy to choke on! I also tried a side order of mac & cheese covered with breadcrumbs that were good.  The service was a little slow and they forgot to put utensils on our table and I had to ask twice for them. However after that our service was speedy and the waitress was polite. I told our waitress that we were in a hurry and had to get back to work and she brought us out some to go boxes without even asking! My total was $10 with tip, and I got two meals out of it.

I hate giving less than 3 stars in my reviews but my experience was very disappointing. I went with co-workers during lunch time because one of them wanted a specific menu item. When we go there, it took the hostess a while to even acknowledge us. When we finally got to our table and started to order, we were told that the menu had changed and they no longer had what my coworker wanted. We decided to order the Pick Three and to our surprise, you really could only pick 2 because wings were mandatory with the meal. If this is the case, they should change the wording in the menu! We called the manager and he apologized and made up for all the trouble. Once we got the food, the disappointment came back. The potstickers were very dry, the potato skins were flavorless and the mozzarella sticks were average. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this restaurant.

So we hit TGIFridays before a night a 4th St and I have to say the experience was at best mediocre. They were not very busy as it was July 4th. And our drinks took a VERY long time to make. I ordered a vodka with soda and 2 lemons twice. TWICE I had to ask for lemons again and at the end of the night when I got my bill I had been charged $8.29/ea for Grey Goose!  BARTENDER TIP! When someone orders Vodka & Soda or Rum & Diet or Bourbon & Coke you have 2 options: 1) Ask them if they have a brand preference 2) Pour and charge them for well liquor. It was HORRIBLY OFFENSIVE that the bartender saw us as easy marks for a bigger tab and recommended the server to ring in the MOST expensive Vodka in house.   If you are going to treat people like tourists AT LEAST make sure they have out of state IDs. TGIFridays on 4th St gets a 3 instead of a 1 for a couple reasons: 1) Pot Stickers and Potato Skins are still delicious 2) Drinks were not weak 3) The manager fixed my bill and apologized and my cost per drink was $4.50/ea as it should have been in the first place.

Two colleagues and I stopped in for dinner on a Thursday night. We should have seen the signs: un-bussed tables, trash on the floor, worn-out menus and both hostesses looking at each other in dazed confusion when we requested a table for 3.  The food was adequate. I had the pecan crusted chicken salad, my buddies had burgers.  The burgers were delivered but the salad was not.  Our server was preoccupied at the computer kiosk with her associates, making getting her attention difficult.  No tea refills and no silverware characterized the service: bored and indifferent.  I understand TGI is a chain but up till now I always held them in high regard. This location has all the classic characteristics of a poorly managed restaurant. Avoiding this location would be my recommendation.

I discussed this with the manager but wanted to point a few things out in addition.  The service was poor.  Stephanie not only had attitude about us being a late table, but she forgot drinks, wanted to bring my beer after she had served our appetizers (no thank you) and also picked up our signed tickets before we left the table so 'she could leave'.  Not only that but our table of four had to listen to the service staff complain about side work and not trading shifts with so and so for the duration of our meals--mind you the restaurant was empty they could have complained anywhere.  The manager came over and apologized, I appreciate that but as we were leaving at 1:30am I noticed at least 7-10 dirty, empty tables as we exited.  So poor service and poor management.  If your service staff has time to complain they have time to clean, completely unacceptable.  As I told him, it had been probably ten years since I had been in a Friday's and  sure it will be more than that before I step foot in your establishment again.

I enjoyed my lunch/dinner as I sat outside on a beautiful day! What more could you ask for? My car to not get towed away by the City of Louisville, that's what! Be careful not to park nearby during the hours of 3-6 pm because I can assure you that the meters take your money and there aren't enough signs to warn you. There was one and I missed it. This cost me $163 plus lunch.

I give them a 5 though their service was a bit slow. They were in between shifts.  I had the side mashed potatoes $1.99 & side Mac & cheese $2.99. I also had the daily mojito which was $3.00. The bill came to $8.46. It was very good. I sat outside, which I recommend if the weather is nice.

Yes, I want to give 4 stars to a TGIF.  But I think this TGIF has earned the 4th star.  Hubby and I have dined here a couple of times over the last month and we were happy with our meal both time.  I am pleasantly surprised by some of the menu additions such as the Grilled Flat Iron Steak.  The steaks were cooked perfectly MR both times.  It had great flavor.  The sides were  pleasant surprises, too.  I chose the Fresh Spinach and Mac n Cheese.  The spinach side turned out to be a pile of tender sautéed spinach with shallots and mushrooms.  The mac n cheese was individually baked with real cream and cheese...yum!  And at $15 (or was it $13?)...this is a great value I have not seen in Louisville.  I was so impressed with the changes I called to plan a holiday party here for a group.  The hostess was patient and detail oriented.  Due to reasons beyond my control, I ultimately had to cancel my reservation.  But the hostess was still very nice and polite.  I would come back here if I needed to host a party again.  This TGIF has the advantage of a fun location, food with universal appeal (even for a choosy one like me!) plus a great staff!!

The Cajun chicken shrimp Alfredo was awesome. The service was great. My wife loved the turkey burger. The Cajun dish didn't look good and I almost didn't want to try it. But I am so glad I did. I think I will order it again and again. We actually went there yesterday for lunch. We went back today and I ordered the jack Daniels burger.  I usually don't order burgers. But this one was great. The server was friendly.

Myself and 2 of my kids (19 & 20) decided to come here for dinner tonight.  We walked in and there was no wait, we said 3 please, the hostess had us follow her all way to the back of the restaurant passing many clean open tables & booths. She goes to seat us at a table right in front of the kitchen door. I looked at her and said umm can we have a booth please, I got a nasty look and snide remark that I should of said that in 1st place, I said back maybe if I was asked in the 1st place I would of.  Once we were seated at a booth next to 2 big parties, we waited over 7 minutes to be even acknowledge, was about to give up when server came up to us asked us if we been helped yet? we said no!  He took our drink order and app order. He brought drinks, and we did ask for a few more minutes to look over the menu. Ordered fine,  Our apps came out by someone else didn't bring us plates or even silverware or even ask if we needed them.  My son ordered Chicken Strips & Fries, Daughter ordered Grilled chicken & cheese, myself wishing I didn't order the All American stack burger. My kids were almost happy with their meals, tasted good but small portions for the money they are charging. My burger was so-so. It defiantly did not look anything like the picture, was missing the sauce and extra cheese they said came on it, my side was total 22 french fries lol (so few so I counted) We had to wave down server just to get refill on our sodas and teas, he was busy with larger parties next to us, and trying to set up even bigger table for his next party.  We watch him and 2 hostess loudly talk and complain how many tables need to go together and them set it up with not checking on us or his other booth. Watching them touch their faces and hair putting napkins and silverware down, picking table signs up off floor and putting them on back on table.  When I asked for check didn't even ask if meal was okay, just brought us check and togo box for my daughter.  Food was less then standard what I am use to from this restaurant and service was horrid.  I know how it is to be a server, bartender & cook, I did it for years and all I can say is if these people were on my staff when I was manger they would been wrote up and sent home. We will not be back even for a 2nd chance, I don't get to go out with my kids often because their college and work so next time we go out to eat together will never be this restaurant.

I took my grand daughter here after church today. We ordered the all you could apps for $10 each. The selection was limited to only four items  Boneless chicken wings pot stickers mozzarella stick and potato things. We were told that after the first full order they would come as half orders no problem, but wasn't told if you change from the original order there was a $2 charge. No problem.  But here the thing the food was nasty the service was bad. I had to ask the host after she seated her guest to get me a Sprite. Our server only came around maybe twice the whole time. Would I go back for another special...No Would I go back for a regular meal.....No

Took 5 minutes get a beer and we were sitting at the bar.  There was a child sitting at the bar, probably wouldn't have noticed but he was crying and not to forget the table of 20 girls that got louder and louder by the minute. We finished the one beer we managed to order and got out of there.

The food here is good. Its standard TGI Fridays food that you can expect anywhere else. The staff wasnt as friendly as they could be though. Be friendlier and more engaging with guests and get more tips! We ended up here because the bar down the block apparently wasnt serving food past midnight.
Nothing to write home about but nothing to complain about either.  The blueberry LIT was delicious!

I don't expect much from the big chains and this establishment definetly didn't deliver much.  1.Upon arrival the hostess seemed confused as to what tables were available, despite the fact that at 930pm the place was only 30% full.  2. The waiter was somewhat between unfriendly and rude.  3. Waited 15 mins for drinks and 25 mins for the 2 appetizers we ordered.  4. My lady accidentally spilled her drink and after hunting down our unfriendly waiter, he flung a pile of napkins at us and walked away, no one else came to assist, we cleaned up the spill and put the pile of soaked napkins on a plate on our table. 5 mins after we cleaned up the mess the waiter offered to make her a new drink, which took another 15 mins to arrive, my soda was empty this whole time and never got refilled, despite my request.  5. The 2 tables on either side of us all had problems with their checks, some items not there, some extra items added, and needed 3 revisions before being close to accurate.  Hostess ignored us as we walked right past when leaving. I suspect my facial expression showed my opinion of this dining experience.  In short, this is a prime location for such a poor restaurant, walk a few feet either direction to somewhere else, downtown Louisville has a number of great options!

On April 14 while attending a conference in Louisville, KY two friends and I decided to go to the TGI Fridays on 4th #1108. We arrived around 10pm. We sat in the bar area at one of the high tops. The hostess came over to let us know our server would be over shortly.  Within a few moments he came over. We asked for three waters and three beers. The waters came immediately. 30 minutes later the beers came.  We soon realized that our waiter was taking care of the entire bar area and the bar tender was taking care of peope at the bar.  So we moved to the bar thinking the service would be better.  So we placed our order. Avis Criss Gordon ordered the Sizzlin Chicken, Tyrone ordered the Cheeseburger and I ordered the Chicken Tenders.  40 minutes later our food arrived. The French Fries were cold and the Tenders were under cooked and the Sizzling Chicken had sizzled out, burned, and cold. When I brought this to the bar tenders attention his response was i didn't cook it nor did i serve it, I just took your order.  WHAT??? We couldn't believe what we had just heard and witnessed. The MOD came over and apologize and attempt to make things right by taking care our meal. Just know We will Never Ever step foot in another TGI Fridays.

The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was our experience when we first walked in the door. It was 2 in the afternoon so it was really slow but for some reason it took 5 minutes for anyone to say hi and greet us. 3 different employees walked by and never said a word.  When we were finally seated our server was quick and had great suggestions for our meal. I had the chicken and shrimp with the jack Daniel's sauce and it was to die for. The potato skins were okay. Our drinks were refilled promptly and food was out in perfect timing. I will be back again solely because of the service. Our server was Amber and she did a fantastic job!! Thanks Amber we will be back... but only if your working!

This was my first trip to Louisville and my first dining experience in KY. From reading the reviews, I didn't expect good service or good food here. However, I was surprised. I had a flat iron steak with fried shrimp, broccoli, and mac and cheese. Both sides weren't seasoned with salt, but the steak and shrimp were very good. My sister had sizzling chicken and cheese, and my mother had a rack of ribs with fries and coleslaw. Neither one of them complained about their food. Our server, Kaela, was very friendly and got us what we needed when we asked. I don't know if this is typical of the restaurant since I read many less than favorable reviews on Yelp. If good service and food is like this all the time, I'd have no problem eating here again when I'm in town, and I'm sure the place would be packed with customers writing good reviews instead of what I read on Yelp.

The first time I went in they sat three groups then told me it was a thirty minute wait. Empty tables all around in the restaurant. I left.  Went back with a large group (not by choice) and it was really good. Our waiter (Rob) made the experience so amazing!

I have a love-hate relationship with this TGI Friday's.   The restaurant chain itself serves great food and drinks. This specific location on Fourth Street Live has been a convenient place for lunch ever since I was in high school. Lately, it's gone a little bit downhill.   I'm really big on friendliness of the personnel, and here is a hit or miss. I've had a few great servers and bartenders, but normally the staff I encounter don't have much energy and look like they would rather be elsewhere.    I came in for lunch with my dad. Once we were seated, there were 6 employees sprawled out at the tables and booths next to us hanging out. I can totally get if someone's on their break, but they were there the entire time we were...    Their appetizers are probably the best part. From spinach dip to pretzels with bier cheese, you get a pretty nice selection. The entree was alright, I ordered the baby back ribs with fries. The portion size was oddly small. I finished everything and was still a little hungry (usually I can't even get past a plate of ribs before giving up!)   It's a fine place to go for a regular traditional lunch, but not anywhere that will amaze you.

Nice spot to go before drinks. They have a larger selection than I remember. The staff was very friendly and inviting. I had their Jack Daniel's chicken and it was surprisingly better than I thought it'd be. There isn't anything bad to say about this place really.

If you're visiting the area, stay far away from this place.  Was in there on Saturday night, Oct. 8th, and the blonde bartender is probably the worst bartender ever.  Rude, un-attentive and never once smiled.  She was more concerned about looking at her phone then taking care of customers.  Was with my wife and another couple and we were all shocked by the horrible service.  We left a 10% tip and that was probably way more than she deserved.  There are lots of good choices near with good service, so stay away from this place.

Stopped in to get some lunch. Took a while before someone ever acknowledged that I was sitting at the bar to have my order taken. I'd understand if they were busy but it was maybe 7 people in here eating. But it is what it is just got some chicken tenders and fries.

My friend and I came here before a show at The Palace. I'd seen the advertisements for the unlimited $10 apps and was curious about them. I got there around 6:15 on a Friday night and there was a 30 minute wait. We put our name in and ended up getting a table after only 15-20 minutes, which was nice. Our server introduced herself to us after 5 minutes of waiting for someone to come to our table. This was particularly frustrating since we were on a strict timeline to make it to the show. When she explained that you can't share the appetizers and EACH person must pay $10, I was a little turned off. I only ended up getting the apps and got potato skins and boneless BBQ wings as my refill. The first app is a full order and the second is only a half order. For this I was thankful, because otherwise the portions would have been much too large to eat alone. I ate the wings first and they were way too salty with minimal sauce. The potato skins were bland and seemed to have been sitting in the back for a few minutes before being brought out. I couldn't eat all the skins by myself, and wanted to try a different app,but our server didn't return for quite a bit. By the time she did, we needed our checks.  Not sure if I would want to try this place again, but if I did, it definitely wouldn't be on a Friday night when I'm on a time crunch.

They always are understaffed and the waits are a constant struggle regardless of the day and time. Quite aggravating when you just want to sit and enjoy some food. The hostess' never seem to acknowledge your existence.

Had lunch today with my wife. The service was nice and friendly. My wife had the spinach artichoke flatbread. Not very good. The bread tasted stale. I had the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich. The sandwich was good, but my fries were cold. Not sure why, as they were busy. I can't understand why restaurant don't​put more emphasis on the side items. Also we thought the flatbread was over priced at $9.49, that was only .49 cents less than my sandwich. Not a good value. They have paired down the menu and isn't worth a return trip.

Busy area, throw in a Prom and and a national archery touney, gotcha, but this Fridays is not organized and unfriendly. There were 3 hostesses 5/12/17. Can you hire any less quality people? I doubt it! With a line in the little lobby, the 3 ladies giggle as a group of 3 guys walked by and the girls wanted the guys info while writing their own digets down. Then one of the ladies (neck tattoos galore) go running after the guys with another girl soon to follow. The third hostess disappeared. Soon a few of the wait team came looking for customers. After the hostesses finished their smokes and texts, they came back in (not washing their hands by the way). These ladies are as worm as a week old corpse. After the 45 minute wait (which was actually 1hr 15 min) we are seated. Ten minutes after being seated our uninterested server showed up. No sense of urgency. We are seated at a table with a City of Louisville orange street cone right by it (carpted floor). Ten more minutes for drinks, and a half hour for food. Food was ok, one saving grace. This place needs to look at their operations. I know it is in a busy spot, but you need staff to work with, not just in numbers but with quality and interested people.Staff to the needs of the business. I get that everyone has a bad night, but this is the third time in 6 months I have visited Louisville and come to this Fridays and got the same service, the ONLY reason i have gone back is because the wait at Fridays is shorter because people just don't consider going there. This visit has steered me away from this Fridays, I wont be back.
The service was extremely slow for simple orders. There were hardly anybody in the restaurant. Very disappointed.

I went there on Friday night around 9pm with my husband. I have been to different TGIF restaurants in different locations. This is the worse place I've ever been. Food was good but the customer service was bad as Macdonald level (no offense ;))  Even I saw several seats available, we waited about ten mins to be seated. It looked everything isn't organized and obviously slow.Restaurant was not clean either...  My husband stood up for restroom, and accidentally bumped into one of the waitress. He said "excuse me" but she didn't say anything and just left.  Used glasses were everything.  I'm hoping they will hire a better manager! Because I like TGIF restaurants.

Food was decent.  Diet coke was great(sounds dumb but, it tastes better at certain establishments, ya know?). Drink prices not listed on menus stunk. Waiter was horrible- Took our drink order and never came back. Eventually two other very busy women, Tammy and Sherie(pardon misspelling), tended to us and got us our food and drinks. We ordered endless apps and got one plate of them and eventually had to stop a waitress 20 minutes after we finished our meal to get a second. Tammy and Sherie were incredible. David on the other hand was too busy at the empty bar- on his phone- to serve people.
Poor service , Bad food = Disappointing! Never got refills , steak was wrong cut and blah.  Overall a disappointing visit. Place was not busy so not sure what the poor service was about.

It's TGI Fridays, you know what your getting, decent modern American cuisine. What made this Fridays special was our server Laura. Laura was extremely attentive to our needs, glasses barely went half empty before she refilled them, and she took care of all our needs. The food gets 3 stars, because it was good but nothing special. Laura gets 5 stars because she is exactly what you want in a server.

So incredibly poor. When seated, we passed multiple tables that hadn't been cleaned. It wasn't at all busy, and adequate staff were around chatting. Once we were seated, we waited for over 10 minutes and no one came to our table.  We ended up just leaving and glad that we did.

Location location location! If you have never been to 4th St. Live, I would highly recommend it! The atmosphere of this area is fun and touristy! Not to mention the high quality food choices, with TGI Friday's being one of those options! Good food, good service, clean and inviting restaurant! If you're not big into crowds, you might want to avoid this area on the weekends, as it is a very popular location for concerts and other activities! Have been to this specific location numerous times, and have been pleased every time!

We went here during the Ironman event. The restaurant was packed. The food was decent. Our server Natalie was awesome though. They messed up my boyfriend's order but Natalie noticed it right away and promptly corrected it before we even asked. They ran out of all the soups beside tomato so I got that and a smoothie. My strawberry smoothie was sour. I asked for an addition of the strawberry pearls that only included with the tea. Natalie was hesitate at my weird request of having the pearls in my drink but she went along with it anyway. It was a good move because I loved those pearls. The sweet strawberry juice was coated with a thin layer of jelly just popped in your mouth. It was so fun to eat and balanced out the sourness of the smoothie. FYI, you could find these pearls in your bubble tea places also.
My first time here, I was in town for a concert. Food was good, drinks were kept up on. Bartender was pretty good since she was the only one working keeping up with everyone.

As soon as we walked in someone told us we should leave. There was a big party that was leaving and I guess they had bad service (it seemed like a rowdy group).  Their waitress saw them badmouthing Friday's to us. She started yelling at them as they were leaving and told them to come back and clean the table off. It seemed very inappropriate even if they weren't good customers.  We wanted to stay anyway. It took about 5 minutes for them to decide where to put us.  We got a seat in the bar area.  The two of us got the shakes drinks.  They were about $10 a piece but you get 2-3 drinks out of it. Mine only filled up 2 drinks while the other filled up 3.  I wish it was more consistent because mine obviously had too much ice in it.  They were both very good drinks.  They weren't very strong because neither of us could feel it after finishing the shaker.  I've always liked the cheese sticks so it was great.  They taste better with ketchup.  People think that's weird but it's better than marinara honestly. My sister got the jack Daniels chicken strips and she liked them.   We had a 20% off coupon and forgot to tell her before we got our checks. She was nice about it and went back and changed them.   We had a good experience here.  If you act rude and crazy like the group before us, then maybe you won't have the best time.

Worst excuse for a restaurant that I've seen in years. Had a group of six and most everything that came out was either cold or still "frozen". Were there no real cooks in this he kitchen? Definitely will not ever grace this poor excuse of an eatery again. Waitress was apologetic, but you could tell she had seen this many times before. I know they need places on 4th St. for people to go, but really? Maybe it should just be for drinks only.

Service was horrible. The waitress was too busy playing around with some guy, and not paying us any attention. She gave me my fish n chips, but forgot the coleslaw. 15 minutes later she came back, and the coleslaw was hot from being under the heatlamp for 15 minutes.

Very dissatisfied. Ordered the jack Daniels chicken sandwich for both me and my daughter. Neither one had the Cajun onion strings on it. I had already eaten a few bites. We had to wait an additional 20 minutes for them and were treated as if we were making a special request instead of not having the correct order. By the time the onion strings arrived there was only enough for one sandwhich and both of our sandwhiches we're cold. No apology was made and no offer of a reduction on the bill. Very poor service.
Di-sgust-ing  YUCk! Gross food. Gross. There's too many good restaurants in town to even justify eating here.
